column1: Parity w/Sawtooth
column23: This epic is complete when Transact is at feature-parity with Sawtooth, to the extent that Sawtooth can start using Transact instead of it's current python TEP implementation.

column1: Bootstrap HL Transact
column23:
Do all the bootstrapping tasks necessary to get the Transact project to an initial state within HL.

For reference, see list at: https://wiki.hyperledger.org/display/tools/Transact

column1: Implement ZMQ ExecutionAdapter
column23: Implement an ExecutionAdapter that provides support for transaction handlers over ZMQ.  This should allow Sawtooth transaction processors to connect to a transact-backed instance.
column42: (Please add high level design or a link to the design)

column1: Write MultiScheduler
column23: The MultiScheduler will allow running multiple schedulers at once to verify that they produce equivalent results. This will be useful in testing correctness between the serial and parallel scheduler, and proving determinism of the parallel scheduler.
column42: (Please add high level design or a link to the design)

column1: Improve shutdown behaviour
column23:
Currently, shutdowns are often handle with a combination of {{receiver.recv_timeout()}} and an atomic boolean.  This should be replaced with an internal enum that signals shutdown, with a priority channel that prioritizes the shutdown signal over other items.

One area where this would be very effective is in the
column42: (Please add high level design or a link to the design)

column1: Prove correctness of the SerialScheduler
column23:
* generate blocks in a Sawtooth chain
 * feed the batches into transact with a serial scheduler
 * show that the correct state root hash is produced.
column42: (Please add high level design or a link to the design)

column1: Add shim for command family capture
column23: It is desirable to be able to run smart contract engines under a workload and capture the get/set/delete statements (from the point of view of the context manager or executor) in such a way that they can be replayed later using the command smart contract engine.
column42: (Please add high level design or a link to the design)

column1: Add error callback to Scheduler trait
column23: Add an error callback to the Schedulers that's used when an error is encountered that's not correlated with a specific batch. This will be used initially by the serial scheduler to report when a task completion notification is received for a transaction that's not the current transaction.

column1: Add a Into method to convert receipt::StateChange to a state::StateChange
column23:
The [state change enum|[https://github.com/hyperledger/transact/blob/master/libtransact/src/protocol/receipt.rs#L34-L37]] in a receipt cannot be used to apply an update to a database without a manual transformation into the [state module state change enum|[https://github.com/hyperledger/transact/blob/master/libtransact/src/state/mod.rs#L40-L43]].

The receipt module should have a method to convert into a state module version of the enum
column42: (Please add high level design or a link to the design)

column1: Support PostgreSQL database backend
column23: It is desirable to support a PostgreSQL database backend, in addition to the current LMDB implementation. In part, to make it easier to use Transact in cloud environments.

column1: Support Redis database backend
column23: It is desirable to support a Redis database backend in addition to the current LMDB backend. In part, this is to better support using Transact in cloud environments.
